newsitem.title: UK: Britain dismayed over Cyprus missile purchase.
newsitem.headline: Britain dismayed over Cyprus missile purchase.

text.p: Britain said on Thursday it was dismayed by Cyprus' decision to buy anti-aircraft missiles from Russia and urged the Cypriots to reconsider.
"The decision to buy this weapons system is not a welcome development," a Foreign Office spokesman said.
"Our charge d'affaires in Nicosia met Cypriot Foreign Minister Michaelides to express to the government of Cyprus our dismay at their decision. We urged them to reconsider," the spokesman added.
Turkey has said it is seriously considering staging a military strike if Cyprus goes ahead with plans to deploy the missiles on the divided island.

Ankara has accused the Cypriot government of trying to change the balance of forces on Cyprus with a deal announced last weekend to buy Russian S-300 surface-to-air missiles that could neutralise Turkish air superiority on the island.
The Foreign Office spokesman said Britain's ambassadors in Ankara and Athens had both stressed the need for a measured approach. "We have called for restraint in public statements."
